verses.text_plain: And now, O ye priests, this commandment is for you.
verses.verse_html: 1And now, O ye priests, this commandment is for you.

verses.text_plain: If ye will not hear, and if ye will not lay it to heart, to give glory unto my name, saith the Lord of hosts, I will even send a curse upon you, and I will curse your blessings: yea, I have cursed them already, because ye do not lay it to heart.
verses.verse_html: 2If ye will not hear, and if ye will not lay it to heart, to give glory unto my name, saith the Lord of hosts, I will even send a curse upon you, and I will curse your blessings: yea, I have cursed them already, because ye do not lay it to heart.

tokens.text: and if ye will not lay
upon you, and I will curse
them already, because ye do not lay

verses.text_plain: Behold, I will corrupt your seed, and spread dung upon your faces, even the dung of your solemn feasts; and one shall take you away with it.
verses.verse_html:
3Behold, I will corrupt your seed, and spread dung upon your faces, even the dung of your solemn feasts; and one shall take you away with it. ▼
▼ corrupt: or, reprove
 , ▼
▼ spread: Heb. scatter
 , ▼
▼ one…: or, it shall take you away to it

footnotes.body_text: ▼ one…: or, it shall take you away to it
footnotes.body_html: ▼ one…: or, it shall take you away to it

verses.text_plain: And ye shall know that I have sent this commandment unto you, that my covenant might be with Levi, saith the Lord of hosts.
verses.verse_html: 4And ye shall know that I have sent this commandment unto you, that my covenant might be with Levi, saith the Lord of hosts.

verses.text_plain: My covenant was with him of life and peace; and I gave them to him for the fear wherewith he feared me, and was afraid before my name.
verses.verse_html: 5My covenant was with him of life and peace; and I gave them to him for the fear wherewith he feared me, and was afraid before my name.

verses.text_plain: The law of truth was in his mouth, and iniquity was not found in his lips: he walked with me in peace and equity, and did turn many away from iniquity.
verses.verse_html: 6The law of truth was in his mouth, and iniquity was not found in his lips: he walked with me in peace and equity, and did turn many away from iniquity.

verses.text_plain: For the priest’s lips should keep knowledge, and they should seek the law at his mouth: for he is the messenger of the Lord of hosts.
verses.verse_html: 7For the priest’s lips should keep knowledge, and they should seek the law at his mouth: for he is the messenger of the Lord of hosts.

verses.text_plain: But ye are departed out of the way; ye have caused many to stumble at the law; ye have corrupted the covenant of Levi, saith the Lord of hosts.
verses.verse_html:
8But ye are departed out of the way; ye have caused many to stumble at the law; ye have corrupted the covenant of Levi, saith the Lord of hosts. ▼
▼ stumble at: or, fall in

footnotes.body_html: ▼ stumble at: or, fall in

verses.text_plain: Therefore have I also made you contemptible and base before all the people, according as ye have not kept my ways, but have been partial in the law.
verses.verse_html:
9Therefore have I also made you contemptible and base before all the people, according as ye have not kept my ways, but have been partial in the law. ▼
▼ have been…: or, lifted up the face against: Heb. accepted faces

footnotes.body_text: ▼ have been…: or, lifted up the face against: Heb. accepted faces
footnotes.body_html: ▼ have been…: or, lifted up the face against: Heb. accepted faces

verses.text_plain: Have we not all one father? hath not one God created us? why do we deal treacherously every man against his brother, by profaning the covenant of our fathers?
verses.verse_html: 10Have we not all one father? hath not one God created us? why do we deal treacherously every man against his brother, by profaning the covenant of our fathers?

tokens.text: us? why do we deal treacherously

verses.text_plain: Judah hath dealt treacherously, and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah hath profaned the holiness of the Lord which he loved, and hath married the daughter of a strange god.
verses.verse_html:
11Judah hath dealt treacherously, and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah hath profaned the holiness of the Lord which he loved, and hath married the daughter of a strange god. ▼
▼ loved: or, ought to love

footnotes.body_html: ▼ loved: or, ought to love

verses.text_plain: The Lord will cut off the man that doeth this, the master and the scholar, out of the tabernacles of Jacob, and him that offereth an offering unto the Lord of hosts.
verses.verse_html:
12The Lord will cut off the man that doeth this, the master and the scholar, out of the tabernacles of Jacob, and him that offereth an offering unto the Lord of hosts. ▼
▼ the master…: or, him that waketh, and him that answereth

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the master…: or, him that waketh, and him that answereth
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the master…: or, him that waketh, and him that answereth

verses.text_plain: And this have ye done again, covering the altar of the Lord with tears, with weeping, and with crying out, insomuch that he regardeth not the offering any more, or receiveth it with good will at your hand.
verses.verse_html: 13And this have ye done again, covering the altar of the Lord with tears, with weeping, and with crying out, insomuch that he regardeth not the offering any more, or receiveth it with good will at your hand.

verses.text_plain: Yet ye say, Wherefore? Because the Lord hath been witness between thee and the wife of thy youth, against whom thou hast dealt treacherously: yet is she thy companion, and the wife of thy covenant.
verses.verse_html: 14Yet ye say, Wherefore? Because the Lord hath been witness between thee and the wife of thy youth, against whom thou hast dealt treacherously: yet is she thy companion, and the wife of thy covenant.

tokens.text: against whom thou hast dealt treacherously

verses.text_plain: And did not he make one? Yet had he the residue of the spirit. And wherefore one? That he might seek a godly seed. Therefore take heed to your spirit, and let none deal treacherously against the wife of his youth.
verses.verse_html:
15And did not he make one? Yet had he the residue of the spirit. And wherefore one? That he might seek a godly seed. Therefore take heed to your spirit, and let none deal treacherously against the wife of his youth. ▼
▼ residue: or, excellency
 , ▼
▼ godly…: Heb. seed of God
 , ▼
▼ treacherously: or, unfaithfully

footnotes.body_html: ▼ godly…: Heb. seed of God

verses.text_plain: For the Lord, the God of Israel, saith that he hateth putting away: for one covereth violence with his garment, saith the Lord of hosts: therefore take heed to your spirit, that ye deal not treacherously.
verses.verse_html:
16For the Lord, the God of Israel, saith that he hateth putting away: for one covereth violence with his garment, saith the Lord of hosts: therefore take heed to your spirit, that ye deal not treacherously. ▼
▼ that he…: or, if he hate her, put her away
 , ▼
▼ putting…: Heb. to put away

footnotes.body_text: ▼ that he…: or, if he hate her, put her away
footnotes.body_html: ▼ that he…: or, if he hate her, put her away
▼ putting…: Heb. to put away

verses.text_plain: Ye have wearied the Lord with your words. Yet ye say, Wherein have we wearied him? When ye say, Every one that doeth evil is good in the sight of the Lord, and he delighteth in them; or, Where is the God of judgment?
verses.verse_html: 17Ye have wearied the Lord with your words. Yet ye say, Wherein have we wearied him? When ye say, Every one that doeth evil is good in the sight of the Lord, and he delighteth in them; or, Where is the God of judgment?
